snippet: Israel’s premier sought to put the roiling controversy in historical context and evoked his longstanding sense of mission regarding Iran.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu confirms for third time that he still plans to speak to joint meeting of Congress regarding his objections to Iran's nuclear program; Democrats have objected to circumstances surrounding visit by Netanyahu, to whom House Speaker John Boehner issued invitation without consulting Democrats or White House.

byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Israel’s premier sought to put the roiling controversy in historical context and evoked his longstanding sense of mission regarding Iran.

headline.main: Netanyahu Says Speech to Congress Is His Duty
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Says Speech to Congress Is His Duty
